returns._0: the same vaults info with the price data populated

params.tokenAddress: the asset of which the price is to be quoted

returns._0: the USD price of the asset

params.baseAssets: the assets of which the price is to be quoted

returns.prices: the USD prices of the asset

getRelativePrice(address,address).details: this is a dummy function that tries to read from the state

params.baseToken: the token of which the price is to be quoted
params.quoteToken: the token used to denominate the price

returns._0: the number of units of quote token per base token

fetchPricesUSD((address,uint8,address,ui.notice: Fetches the price of the vault token as well as the underlying tokens

getPriceUSD(address).notice: Quotes the USD price of `tokenAddress` The quoted price is always scaled with 18 decimals regardless of the source used for the oracle.

getPricesUSD(address[]).notice: Quotes the USD price of `baseAssets` The quoted prices is always scaled with 18 decimals regardless of the source used for the oracle.

getRelativePrice(address,address).notice: Quotes the price of `baseToken` relative to `quoteToken` The quoted price is always scaled with 18 decimals regardless of the source used for the oracle.

isPairSupported(address,address).notice: Returns whether the oracle currently supports prices for `baseToken` relative to `quoteToken`

documentation.text:
@inheritdoc IRelativePriceOracle
 @dev this is a dummy function that tries to read from the state
